alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 3:17PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY RAIN AND RISING FREEZING LEVELS THROUGH MONDAY... A warm front will cause precipitation to track into the region from south to north on Friday. Winds out of the south with increased speeds will allow warming temperatures through the inner channels Friday. Meanwhile, snow/freezing levels will steadily rise. Freezing levels over Yakutat will reach 2,000 to 3,000 feet while the Petersburg to Sitka area tops out at over 5,000 feet Sunday. Rainfall totals over this 4 day period will vary as two or more surges of moisture move through, but are likely to reach 0.5-1.5 inches on Friday and again Saturday, then 1-2 inches Sunday and Monday. Some strong wind gusts of around 40 mph may accompany the surges of moisture, particularly along the outer coast.
